answers.answer: Hello.From your numbers I would say you are early diabetic.  I don't like the term prediabetic, as it seems to indicate you don't need to be concerned yet.You do, and now is the best time to control this.Ideal fasting blood sugar is in the mid 80s (70 - 90 still normal range)...  Post eating should be less than 120 if it is normal.Hba1c should be < 5.0, to be totally normal.Maybe if y ou can curb your sweet tooth this will help a lot. Y Ou need to look t your diet and reduce the sweets and carbs. Maybe you can replace the sweets with things like nuts (not covered in sugar), or small amounts of fruit.you can test your blood sugar after eating a meal (1 1/2 hours).  If your blood sugar is < 120 then  you know that the foods you just ate were suitable.  If your blood sugar is high, then you know you need to change what you ate (reducing carbs / sugars - increasing protein / healthy fats).Exercise for 30 minutes after eating may help control blood sugar.  You p probably should consider discussing with your dr about taking metformin.  Further, given your age and normal weight, your dr should keep a fairly close eye on things and if things progress, you could consider insulin or oral meds..

question: Hi Folks,I am 37, Indian -  non smoker and a very rare drinker. I am 177 cms in height and 84 Kgs in weight. No heredity for diabetes. Normal kidney function and liver enzymes.
